# NSRange

**Type Alias**

A structure used to describe a portion of a series, such as characters in a string or objects in an array.

## Declaration

```swift
typealias NSRange = _NSRange
```

## Discussion

Foundation functions that operate on ranges include the following:

- [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSEqualRanges(_:_:)]
- [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSIntersectionRange(_:_:)]
- [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSLocationInRange(_:_:)]
- [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMakeRange(_:_:)]
- [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMaxRange(_:)]
- [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSRangeFromString(_:)]
- [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSStringFromRange(_:)]
- [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSUnionRange(_:_:)]

## Creating a range

- **init()**: Creates an empty range.
- **init(location:length:)**: Creates a range with the given location and length.

## Accessing range properties

- **location**: The index of the first member of the range.
- **length**: The number of items in the range.

## Managing ranges

- **NSEqualRanges(_:_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether two given ranges are equal.
- **NSIntersectionRange(_:_:)**: Returns the intersection of the specified ranges.
- **NSLocationInRange(_:_:)**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether a specified position is in a given range.
- **NSMakeRange(_:_:)**: Creates a new NSRange from the specified values.
- **NSMaxRange(_:)**: Returns the sum of the location and length of the range.
- **NSRangeFromString(_:)**: Returns a range from a textual representation.
- **NSStringFromRange(_:)**: Returns a string representation of a range.
- **NSUnionRange(_:_:)**: Returns the union of the specified ranges.

## Related types

- **NSRangePointer**: Type indicating a parameter is a pointer to an `NSRange` structure.
- **NSNotFound**: A value indicating that a requested item couldn’t be found or doesn’t exist.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomReflectable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Decodable
- Encodable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
